programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Clare's sinister plan unravels when a daring escape throws everything into chaos. Cleo's baby news sparks tension and rifts. And a bombshell from the past stops Grace in her tracks.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Marie's meddling drives a wedge between Cleo and Sienna, while Jez's surprise return raises eyebrows. Emotions run high for Clare and Grace, and sparks fly between Frankie and Jacob.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sheep.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Zocalo: Gordon Ramsay visits a floundering Mexican restaurant which has become an albatross around the necks of its owners, married couple Greg and Mary Russell. (S5 Ep12/17) [SL]

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Spin a Yarn: Gordon Ramsay tries to save the struggling Spin a Yarn restaurant. Despite an expensive refurbishment, the business is tearing apart its owners' marriage. (S5 Ep13/17) [SL]

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Barting Over: Bart moves into a downtown apartment of his own, and befriends famous skateboarder Tony Hawk (guest starring as himself). Also guest starring Blink-182. (S14 Ep11/22)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: I'm Spelling as Fast as I Can: Lisa wins a place at the Spellympics National Spelling Bee but discovers that it's not as clean-cut a competition as she thought. (S14 Ep12/22)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Launch Party and a Whole Human Being: The Coopers can't be found as Mandy goes into labour, and Sheldon is excited about the launch of his database. (S6 Ep14)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Teen Angst and a Smart-Boy Walk of Shame: Sheldon confronts the failure of his database, Georgie and Mandy struggle as new parents, and Missy feels forgotten. (S6 Ep15)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Blindsided: The Dunphys and Pritchetts go head-to-head when Luke decides his best chance of getting into college is to run against Manny in the senior class president election. (S8 Ep3)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Weathering Heights: Phil's excited when he's invited on the local news. And his day gets even better when he meets his weatherman hero, Rainer Shine (guest star Nathan Fillion). (S8 Ep4)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Wedding, Part 1: Mitch and Cam's big day arrives and nothing can ruin it - until nothing turns into a whole lot of somethings and puts wedding planner Pepper to the test. (S5 Ep23)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Allowance Evaporation: Amy is furious when she learns that Sheldon has shared intimate details of their relationship with his colleagues. (S10 Ep16)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comic-Con Conundrum: Cut off from his father's fortune, Raj appoints Sheldon to organise his finances. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con. (S10 Ep17)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Escape Hatch Identification: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj when he's forced to move out of his flat, leading to unexpected conflict. (S10 Ep18)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Roulette Wheel and a Piano Playing Dog: Sheldon realises that he's the weakest student in his class, and Meemaw sets out to expand her gambling business. (S7 Ep2)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Strudel and a Hot American Boy Toy: Sheldon explores Germany behind Mary's back, Missy attempts to pull a fast one on George Sr, and Meemaw and Dale adjust. (S7 Ep3)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Do It Yourself: Phil's feeling pretty good about himself after a successful DIY project. So he convinces Jay to invest in a property that he's always wanted to develop. (S8 Ep13)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Heavy Is the Head: Will Phil have to rethink his property dream? And Cam has to go to hospital but refuses to have an MRI scan because of a traumatic childhood incident in a well. (S8 Ep14)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Bart of War: Bart and Milhouse are caught getting up to no good in Ned Flanders' house and are enrolled in separate clubs to keep them off the streets. (S14 Ep21/22)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe Baby Blues: Moe becomes Maggie's babysitter after saving her from a car accident when he was about to end it all. She gives him a reason to live, but Homer isn't happy. (S14 Ep22/22)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Geology Methodology: Sheldon and Bert collaborate on a research project, but Sheldon feels embarrassed to be associated with the study of geology. (S11 Ep7)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tesla Recoil: Leonard and Howard learn that Sheldon went to work with the military behind their backs. Bernadette thinks Ruchi's trying to steal her job. (S11 Ep8)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bitcoin Entanglement: Sheldon seeks revenge when the guys cut him out of a potentially valuable investment. A secret about Leonard and Penny is revealed. (S11 Ep9)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simpson Christmas Stories: Homer shares his version of Jesus's birth, Grampa tells a Yuletide war story, and Springfield prepares for Christmas. (S17 Ep9/22)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna throws a pre-wedding party for Jez and John Paul. Liberty battles with jealousy, Mercedes gets a call that changes everything, and Martha's confusion leads to a chilling revelation.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Throw Grampa from the Dane: The Simpsons visit Denmark and all fall in love with it - except Homer. Meanwhile, Grampa needs a serious operation. (S29 Ep20/21)

programme.title: New: Below Deck
programme.desc: Brand new series - Breaking Barbie: Fraser urges Barbie to be kinder to Cat. Ben and Sunny balance work and play. Captain Kerry steps in when chef Anthony struggles to keep up. (S11 Ep3/17)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: This time, the Goggleboxers watch In with a Shout, Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars, Rise and Fall, Saving Our Wild Isles, Last Woman on Earth, Obsession and Dr. Down Below. (S21 Ep8)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Plumber Jamie meets Leigh, who's looking for a guy who's good with his hands. Steampunk fan Joe can't believe his luck when he meets Jess, who used to dress up as a Victorian. (S15 Ep3)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Self-professed 'crazy camel lady' Sandra is after a mature man to ride off into the sunset with. Pansexual erotic writer Toni-Ann dreams of being the heroine in her own sexy novel. (S2 Ep2)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Peanut Reaction: Penny throws a surprise party for Leonard, with help from Howard and Raj, but Sheldon's indulgence in an electronics shop throws her off track. (S1 Ep16)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tangerine Factor: When Penny breaks up with her boyfriend, Leonard plucks up the courage to ask her out. And each of them turns to Sheldon for advice about their date. (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Part 3 - A New Hero: Schwoz works to create an anti-virus while Kid Danger and Captain Man battle a villain. Kid Danger's heroism is put to the test as they fight to save the world. (S5, ep 8)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Stealing Home: Hank and Phoebe think the house has been robbed when they discover the furniture missing, but Max admits he hid everything and forces them to earn it all back. (S3, ep 24)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Back to School: Back in elementary school to complete a hero assessment, Phoebe & Max realize that it won't be easy when the instructor is a former classmate that Max tormented. (S3, ep 20)

programme.title: Danger Force
programme.desc: Dumber Force: In an effort to hinder Danger Force's performance, The Cell manipulates Jeff and Mitch Bilsky into buying Swellview Jr. High. Soon, it's up to Bose to save his friends. (S3, ep 8)

programme.title: Sam & Cat
programme.desc: New Goat: Sam and Cat babysit a goat while trying to win over their landlord's obnoxious son who is trying to get the girls evicted. Dice starts managing Goomer, an MMA fighter. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: Sam & Cat
programme.desc: The Brit Brats: Sam and Cat babysit two girls who fool them both. Sam goes to Elderly Acres in an attempt to fulfill a community service requirement for her online high school. (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Henry's Frittle Problem: When Henry's dad gets an offer for a new job, Henry and Ray go undercover to try and stop Henry's dad from getting the job and prevent Henry from having to move. (S4, ep 15)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Toddler Invasion: When The Toddler takes control of the Man Cave, Charlotte and Jasper have to find a way to sneak into the Man Cave and free Kid Danger and Captain Man. (S4, ep 16)

programme.title: The Thundermans: Undercover
programme.desc: From Dust Till Dawn: Chloe is struggling with her leadership skills, but when a villain attacks her school field trip, Max and Phoebe have to put Chloe in charge. (S1, ep 13)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Dinner Party: Max plans to sabotage dinner when Phoebe invites her crush's family over to impress them, but when an unexpected guest arrives, the evening could become a disaster! (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: Rock Island Mysteries
programme.desc: The Message: Reeling from the shock of events at the ball, Taylor puts her concerns aside and focuses her efforts on decoding the rest of Uncle Charlie's message. (S2, ep 3)

programme.title: Rock Island Mysteries
programme.desc: A Photo From The Past: On the day of the Spirit Awards, Taylor discovers a photo of Uncle Charlie from the 1950's. Her investigations unearth a pocket watch with time-bending powers! (S2, ep 4)

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: Battle in the Boscage: Dr. Don't and Dr. Babbles - flanked by Eggforcers and captive tech guru, Nine - search the Boscage Maze for its prism shard. And Sonic has the same plan, too. (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: Battle in the Boscage: Dr. Don't and Dr. Babbles - flanked by Eggforcers and captive tech guru, Nine - search the Boscage Maze for its prism shard. And Sonic has the same plan, too. (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: The Fairly OddParents: A New Wish
programme.desc: Hazel wishes to meet a live dinosaur in 'A Dinosaur in Dimmadelphia', then in 'Fearless', Hazel wishes that Jasmine was fearless. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Dog Day After-School: Desperate to get Mom's tablet back after it is confiscated at school, Billy and Nora get help from Phoebe, who wants to prove she can be as sneaky as Max. (S3, ep 18)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Original Prankster: Despite promising his girlfriend he would stop pranking, Max pulls an epic gag which his friend is about to get expelled for. (S3, ep 21)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Text, Lies, & Video: When a video of Henry and Ray transforming into Kid Danger and Captain Man gets out, Henry must get it back so that his secret identity isn't revealed. (S2, ep 12)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Opposite Universe: Henry and Charlotte are transported into an opposite universe where Ray and Schwoz are evil and want to destroy Piper. They must figure out how to get back. (S2, ep 13)

programme.title: Hunter Street
programme.desc: Badika: Anika is noticeably different now she's 'Badika' but will the others realise there's anything wrong? Oliver, Jasmyn and Florian skip out on their chores and get an unexpected lead. (S4, ep 11)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: Underwater Cleanup: Seeing Sushi's collection of shells, the Buffycats run to the river to look for more, but there's a terrible surprise waiting for them: the river is full of trash! (S2, ep 36)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: Snack Time at the Farm: After a snack at the park, Pilou, Ginny and Bucky's tummies hurt. Luckily, Mimì, the pediatrician cat, is around! (S2, ep 37)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: The Space Rescue: The Cats in Black secret headquarters receives a call for help: it's Astricat, the alien kitty, who is in trouble in outer space. (S2, ep 38)

programme.title: Best & Bester
programme.desc: Bester uncovers undelicious ocurrences in 'Donut Disturb', then in 'The Cursed Amulet', Best and Bester dig up Captain Ironfoot's Cursed Amulet, only to find that Belle wants it too. (S1, ep 17)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Squidward finds a good book which happens to be SpongeBob's private diary, in 'Little Yellow Book', and then in 'Bumper to Bumper', Mrs. Puff is again teaching SpongeBob to drive.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob finds a nasty sea urchin living in the Krusty Krab in 'Eek, An Urchin!', and then in 'Squid's Defense', Squidward convinces SpongeBob and Sandy to teach him karate.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Gargamel switches bodies with Papa Smurf in 'Smurfing Places', then in 'Poet Slam', after Poet mentors Lily in rhyming, he experiences poet-block during the poet slam contest. (S1, ep 26)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: When Smurfette rescues Brainy from a snake, the others ask her to teach them "Smurf-Fu', then in 'Diaper Daddy', everyone is tired of changing Baby's diapers, Handy invents a robot to help.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob embarks on an epic journey to have his spatula reforged in 'Spatula of the Heavens', and then in 'Gary's Playhouse', SpongeBob builds a snail-house for Gary to play in while he is at work.

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: Patrick messes with the space-time continuum in 'The Patterfly Effect', then in 'A Space Affair to Remember', Cecil and Bunny celebrate their anniversary in outer space. (S1, ep 18)

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: Ghost of a Chance: The full Chaos Council gears up for all-out war in Ghost Hill. Shadow worries about leaving Nine to rebuild the prism. Sonic insists Nine is a friend. (S1, ep 16)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Phoebe's a Clone Now: When Phoebe becomes too busy, Max helps her by creating a clone so she can be in two places at once. But the clone starts making trouble for the real Phoebe! (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Balloons of Doom: When Dr. Minyak takes the Man Fans hostage, Captain Man and Kid Danger have to find a way to rescue them without Dr. Minyak seeing them move. (S3, ep 18)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs take some nature lessons in 'Back to Nature', then in 'Okey-Dokey!', Jokey has a new prank - giving Grouchy a potion that makes him say okey dokey to every request. (S2, ep 6)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Papa Smurf wants to prove that alchemy is more powerful than magic in 'Smurfy Magic Duel', then in 'Doctor Brainy & Mister Dumb', Brainy's new invention backfires and leaves him brainless. (S2, ep 7)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: When The Krusty Krab runs out of mustard, Mr. Krabs sends the team to find some more in 'Mustard O' Mine', then in 'Shopping List ', SpongeBob and Sandy have to collect Krabby Patty ingredients.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Mr. Krabs hires Squidward to babysit Pearl for the night in 'Whale Watching', then in 'Krusty Kleaners', after spilling a milkshake during a delivery, SpongeBob vows to clean the entire building!

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: The Louds rent a boat for a day trip on the lake in 'Washed Up', then in 'Recipe for Disaster', Lincoln and Clyde investigate when they discover a frozen food company using Dad's recipes. (S4, ep 6)

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: The Loud kids seek the perfect gift in 'Present Tense', then in 'Any Given Sundae', Lily hears her parents mention ice cream if the kids are good, so she uses baby smarts to avert disasters. (S4, ep 7

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: Patrick and Squidina go undercover to investigate a corrupt novelty product factory in 'Patrickle Jokes', then in 'Pat Roast', The Patrick Show presents The Roast of Patrick Star. (S3, ep 8)

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: Patrick and Squidina follow a runaway idea brick into Randomland in 'All Out of Idea Bricks', then in 'A Fool Schooled', the family provide home-schooling for Patrick. (S3, ep 9)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Revenge of the Smith: Excited to be honoured for their heroism with a school mural, Phoebe and Max learn that the artist holds a grudge and the tribute isn't what they imagined. (S4, ep 16)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: The Thumb Buddies: Captain Man and Kid Danger get jealous when a new crime-fighting team emerges in Swellview. Guest starring Jerry Trainor. (S4, ep 13)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Handy has invented a machine that allows him to understand animals in 'What the bear said', then in 'Parallel Worlds', Clumsy and Dimwitty open up a portal with other worlds. (S3, ep 12)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Bubble goes on an adventure with Firefly in 'Wobbly Tooth', then in 'The Darkest Night', Gargamel creates a switch that can turn off all the lights so that he can find the Smurf village. (S3, ep 13)

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Clyde has a chance to study in France in 'Don't Escar-go', then in 'Double Trouble', Lola and Lana take on Cheryl and Meryl to be crowned the new spokespeople for Auntie Pam's Parlour. (S6, ep 2)

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Save Royal Woods!: When Royal Woods is in danger of being flooded to make room for a sixth Great Lake, the town comes together to prove that they're worth saving. (S6, ep 4)

programme.title: Sonic Prime

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: An imprisoned Plankton tries to break out of jail and steal the secret formula in 'Jailbreak!', and then in 'Evil Spatula', Spongebob replaces his broken spatula with a magical one from Plankton.

programme.title: The Thundermans: Undercover

programme.title: Henry Danger

programme.desc: Goomer Sitting: When Sam and Cat agree to babysit Goomer while Dice goes away, they misapply Goomer's medicine, causing him to temporarily lose his eyesight before a big match. (S1, ep 6)

programme.desc: School Run: Milo getting to school on time no matter what! (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: The Inbestigators

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.desc: The Case of the Vanishing Koalas / The Case of the Extremely Empty Freezer: Kakow Koalas are the latest snack sensation sweeping the playground. (S2 Ep4)

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.desc: The Case of the Freaky Frequency / The Case of the Tricky Trimathlon: When the ice-cream shop loses business because customers can't lock their cars, the Inbestigators must uncover why! (S2 Ep7)

programme.title: Kung Fu Sock
programme.desc: Hao's Disappearance: Tee Zeng is almost certain that Hiro Hao is Sword Hero. She wants to tell Hiro Hao her secret identity as Kung Fu Girl too. (S1 Ep26)

programme.desc: : Because of one of Marinette's careless mistakes, one of her closest relatives is akumatized into Qilin, a fearsome supervillain. Will Ladybug dare to fight her? (S4 Ep20)

programme.title: Mermicorno: Starfall
programme.desc: Total Eclipse of My Heart: The Mermicornos make a daring attempt to rescue Pearl Girl from Ika Inkblot's lair, but not everything goes according to plan. (S1 Ep113)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Witchful Thinking: Draculaura desperately searches for her "unique witchy power" in order to attend a special witchcraft camp. (S1 Ep49)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Monster Match: Frankie has to figure out a cool way to ask Cleo out to the Monster Ball before Deuce can ask her, first. (S1 Ep50)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: The Monster Way Part 1: Clawdeen leads the monster representatives in the Blood Moon Eclipse ceremony to bring her mom back. (S1 Ep51)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: The Monster Way Part 2: Clawdeen, Draculaura, Frankie and the rest of the boo crew must save the Monster Ball - and the world! (S1 Ep52)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Sniffer Sniffler Raccoon: Grizzy's last jar of chocolate spread has been pinched by the Lemmings, who are savouring it in secret. (S1 Ep67)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Transformational Bear: Grizzy uses the Lemmings' radio-controlled toy robot as a butler. (S1 Ep68)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Shaken-Up Bear: The vibrations created by Grizzy's snoring during his nap give the Lemmings an idea for a bouncing game. (S1 Ep69)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Piñata Party: Grizzy finds a birthday piñata in the ranger's living room. (S1 Ep70)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Game: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a magical Game of the Goose. The events displayed in the squares that the players land on come true in real life. (S1 Ep71)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Ranger Lemming: Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove. (S1 Ep72)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Halloween Bear: Grizzy discovers the leftovers of a Halloween party in the ranger's cabin and carries on the party with the Lemmings. (S1 Ep73)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Clean Bear: Grizzy wants to give she-bear a plastic ring. But since it was found in the trash, he needs to wash it first, and the Lemmings are using the only bar of soap in the house! (S1 Ep74)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Wandering Spirits: Grizzy finds a strange figurine with the power to switch the spirits of two living beings and finds himself imprisoned in the body of a caribou. (S1 Ep75)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Mirror, Mirror on the Wall: While salmon fishing on the riverbank, Grizzy hauls in an unusual catch: an old hand mirror straight out of a fairy tale. (S1 Ep76)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy the Wizard: The Lemmings find a magic stick that makes objects come alive. Grizzy is sure the stick would save him a lot of work, the only problem is how to get it from the Lemmings. (S1 Ep77)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Moonwalk Bear: Grizzy tries to stop the Lemmings playing with fireworks. (S1 Ep78)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Gliding: The Lemmings kite surf with a homemade kite. Grizzy decides to make a kite that is far more sophisticated than the Lemmings' kite to win she-bear's affection. (S1 Ep37)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Sound of a Lemming: Grizzy snatches the last jar of chocolate spread out from under the noses of the Lemmings. In exchange, he offers them the toy stuck inside the lid: a mini-flute. (S1 Ep38)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear in the Wind: The Lemmings play a new game but interrupt Grizzy watching his favourite TV show. (S1 Ep39)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Construction Bear: Grizzy decides to build a building to impress she-bear. (S1 Ep40)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Kung Fu Lemmings: The Lemmings draw inspiration from lessons they find in a martial arts book and start breaking every wooden object they can get their hands on. (S1 Ep41)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: A Midsummer Bear's Dream: Grizzy dreams that he's a valiant knight but is woken up by the Lemmings blasting music. Grizzy has only one desire: pick up his dream where he left off. (S1 Ep42)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Manufacturing Secret: Grizzy has run out of chocolate spread. He realises that the Lemmings are making their own. If they can make it, then why can't he? But first, he needs the recipe! (S1 Ep43)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bling Bling Bear: Inspired by a magazine showing a man offering a diamond to a woman, Grizzy imagines himself offering the ranger's engagement ring to his beloved she-bear. (S1 Ep44)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Intellectual Bear: When he accidentally sticks a computer microprocessor to his head, Grizzy is transformed into a being capable of predicting events to come far in advance. (S1 Ep45)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Castaway (1986)
programme.desc: 1986. Adventure. Director: Nicolas Roeg. Stars Oliver Reed, Amanda Donohoe & Georgina Hale. A young woman seeking adventure volunteers to spend a year on a deserted island with a middle aged man. [S]

programme.title: Black Tuesday
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Directed by Hugo Fregonese. Stars Edward G. Robinson, Jean Parker & Peter Graves. A death row inmate breaks free on the eve of his execution, but will the law catch up with him?

programme.title: Boy Who Caught a Crook
programme.desc: 1961. Family. Directed by Edward L. Cahn. Stars Wanda Hendrix, Don Beddoe & Roger Mobley. A young newsboy becomes the target of a bank robber after he finds a suitcase full of money. [S]

programme.title: It Rained Three Times Last Year
programme.desc: An insightful documentary about the people who live and work within the Sahara Desert, with an additional glimpse at the means of transport used to travel across the vast land.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: John Wesley Hardin. 1955. Stars Hugh O'Brian, Phillip Pine & Barbara Bestar. John Wesley Hardin comes to Wichita seeking revenge against Wyatt for throwing his friend out of town. [S]

programme.title: Music Hall
programme.desc: 1934. Musical. Director: John Baxter. Stars George Carney, Ben Field, Mark Daly & Helena Pickard. A rare film put out by Twickenham Film Studios which includes many original music hall acts. [S]

programme.title: Operation Diplomat
programme.desc: 1953. Crime. Directed by John Guillermin. Stars Guy Rolfe, Lisa Daniely, Patricia Dainton. A surgeon is forced to operate on an injured man by a gang of smugglers. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life The Old School
programme.desc: ... Tie. 1962. A brilliant visit to three of the most famous public schools, showing their background and prospects for the future.

programme.title: Girdle of Gold
programme.desc: 1952. Comedy directed by Montgomery Tully and filmed at Nettlefold. Starring Esmond Knight and Maudie Edwards. A husband hides a fortune in his wife's girdle, only for the girdle to go 'missing'. [S]

programme.title: Cat & Mouse
programme.desc: 1958. Crime Thriller. Directed by Paul Rotha with Lee Patterson. The daughter of a convicted and executed killer believes she has murdered blackmailer Hilton Edwards. [S]

programme.title: Crooks Anonymous
programme.desc: 1962. Comedy. Directed by Ken Annakin. Stars Leslie Phillips, Stanley Baxter & Wilfrid Hyde-White. Petty thief, Dandy Forsdyke, joins an unofficial organisation for reforming criminals. [S]

programme.title: How You See It
programme.desc: 1950. A remarkable short film about the basics of how movie film projection deceives the eye.

programme.title: They Came From Beyond Space
programme.desc: 1967. Sci-Fi. Director: Freddie Francis. Stars: Robert Hutton, Jennifer Jayne, Zia Mohyeddin & Bernard Kay. Scientists investigating an unusual meteor shower are possessed by an alien force. [S]

programme.title: Cash on Demand
programme.desc: 1961. Drama. Directed by Quentin Lawrence. Stars Peter Cushing, Andre Morell & Richard Vernon. A crook abducts the wife and child of a bank manager and then schemes to rob the institution. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life For Crying Out
programme.desc: ... Loud. 1964. A fascinating survey of the advertising industry, with a focus on how it works and what it does.

programme.title: The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre
programme.desc: The Double. 1963. Directed by Lionel Harris. Stars Jeanette Sterke, Robert Brown & Basil Henson. John Cleeve is suffering from 'Homicidal Hallucinations' and can't remember his past. [S]

programme.title: Four Star Playhouse
programme.desc: 1953. Drama. Director: Robert Florey. Stars Merle Oberon, Gordon Oliver & Barbara Billingsley. A woman secretly gets a hearing aid, then learns of her husband's affair and his plan to murder her. [S]

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Hizzonner the Penguin. 1966. Stars Adam West & Burgess Meredith. Suspiciously endearing himself to the citizens of Gotham by foiling a robbery, the Penguin announces he is running for mayor. [S]

programme.title: Dial 999
programme.desc: Exception to the Rule. 1958. Stars Robert Beatty, Paul Whitsun-Jones & Clive Cazes. In accordance to the rules, police officers are unarmed; an exception to the rule is essential in this case. [S]

programme.title: Where Has Poor Mickey Gone?
programme.desc: Unseen for years this strange, B-Picture oddity sees Warren Mitchell superb as fairground magician Emilio Dinelli, tormented by a gang of rowdies who take him prisoner in his backstreet workshop. [S]

programme.title: Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice
programme.desc: 1969. Comedy Drama. Directed by Paul Mazursky. Stars Natalie Wood, Elliott Gould, Robert Culp & Dyan Cannon. Two couples find liberation in the Sexual Revolution of the 1960s. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Join Caroline Munro for an evening of horrifying science fiction delights. First up, is the 1985 sci-fi horror Lifeforce featuring British theatrical greats Frank Finlay and Patrick Stewart. [S]

programme.title: Lifeforce
programme.desc: 1985. Horror. Directed by Tobe Hooper. Stars Steve Railsback, Mathilda May & Patrick Stewart. A space shuttle mission investigating Halley's Comet brings back a malevolent race of space vampires. [S]

programme.title: Lifeforce
programme.desc: 1985. Horror. Directed by Tobe Hooper. Stars Steve Railsback, Mathilda May & Patrick Stewart. A space shuttle mission investigating Halley's Comet brings back a malevolent race of space vampires. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Our next offering, another brilliant sci-fi horror, is The Man Who Turned to Stone. Caroline Munro presents the strange and frightening 1957 film starring Victor Jory. [S]

programme.title: The Man Who Turned To Stone
programme.desc: 1957. Horror. Director: Leslie Kardos. Stars Victor Jory, William Hudson & Charlotte Austin. 18th century scientists, who have discovered the secret to immortality, take over a girl's reformatory. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: As Caroline Munro prepares to close the doors of The Cellar Club, she provides a glimpse of two more unmissable films coming next week. [S]

programme.title: Hammer House of Mystery and Suspense
programme.desc: Czech Mate. 1984. Stars Susan George, Patrick Mower & Peter Vaughan. Vicky goes to Prague with her ex-husband but soon finds herself alone, penniless and caught up in a murder. [S]

programme.title: Europe in 25 Questions
programme.desc: A rare treat, courtesy of a Dutch airline, about air travel in the 1960s.

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: Jed Cuts the Family Tree. 1963. Stars Donna Douglas, Rosemary DeCamp & Bea Benaderet. Mrs. Smith Standish spends more time with the Clampetts, keen to find out if they preceded the 'Mayflower'. [S]

programme.title: Stagecoach West
programme.desc: Object Partimony. Western with Wayne Rogers & Robert Bray, who run a stagecoach line in the Old West where they come across a wide variety of killers, robbers and ladies in distress. [S]

programme.title: Who Goes Next
programme.desc: 1938. War. Director: Maurice Elvey. Stars Barry K. Barnes, Sophie Stewart & Jack Hawkins. During World War One, a number of captured British officers attempt to escape a prisoner-of-war camp. [S]

programme.title: Passport To Treason
programme.desc: 1956. Crime Drama. Directed by Robert S. Baker. Stars Rod Cameron and Lois Maxwell. Clifford, an American private eye, stationed in London for the sake of a murdered friend, takes over a case. [S]

programme.title: The Glass Mountain
programme.desc: 1949. Drama. Classic tale of a war romance featuring the smash hit music of The Legend of The Glass Mountain. Stars Michael Denison, Dulcie Gray & Valentina Cortese, with vocals from Tito Gobbi. [S]

programme.title: Father's Little Dividend
programme.desc: 1951. Comedy. Director: Vincente Minnelli. Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Spencer Tracy & Joan Bennett. Stanley Banks is still recovering from his daughter's wedding when he learns that she is pregnant. [S]

programme.title: The Brothers
programme.desc: Special Licence. 1975. Stars Jennifer Wilson, Jean Anderson & Colin Baker. While everyone's attention is on Edward and Jennifer's wedding, Merroney tries to manipulate Brian's business affairs. [S]

programme.title: City of Bad Men
programme.desc: 1953. Western. Directed by Harmon Jones. Stars Jeanne Crain, Dale Robertson & Richard Boone. After six years in Mexico, an outlaw returns to Nevada, with a plan to rob the Carson City prize-fight. [S]

programme.title: I Love Trouble
programme.desc: 1948. Crime Drama. Directed by S. Sylvan Simon. Stars Franchot Tone, Janet Blair & Janis Carter. A prominent politician hires a private detective to investigate his wife's mysterious past. [S]

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: Pet Healers/Muncaster Castle. 1995. Michael Aspel presents two unusual stories - the first, about a faith healer who treats pets and the other, about one of Britain's most haunted castles. [S]

programme.title: Danger UXB
programme.desc: Cast Iron Killer. 1979. Stars Anthony Andrews, Judy Geeson & Iain Cuthbertson. A sceptical Brian is ordered to deliver a defused but otherwise intact bomb to Dr.Gillespie.

programme.title: Van der Valk
programme.desc: Destroying Angel. 1972. Stars Barry Foster, Michael Latimer & Susan Travers. Van der Valk and Kroon investigate when a local prostitute reports that a man is dying. [S]

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: To Any Lengths. 2003. Stars Bruno Cremer, Martine Sarcey & Maurice Chevit. A man finds a note stating that a fortune teller will die. Shortly after, a fortune teller is found dead. [S]

programme.title: Sex (Re) Education
programme.desc: Stars: Feodor Atkine, Sylwvie Granotier & Irene Jacob. Jacques and Rose want to go away for the weekend, but Isabelle reveals their affair to Rose's son. [S]

programme.title: The Death of Adolf Hitler
programme.desc: 1973. Drama. Directed by Rex Firkin. Stars Frank Finlay, Caroline Mortimer & Oscar Quitak. The story of the last ten days of Hitler's life as his dream of a thousand year Reich became a nightmare. [S]
